segment.source: This topic describes the settings that can be set in Oobe.xml.
segment.target: This topic describes the settings that can be set in Oobe.xml.

segment.source: The following tables show the available settings in the Oobe.xml file, by section, along with the description and the value for each setting.
segment.target: The following tables show the available settings in the Oobe.xml file, by section, along with the description and the value for each setting.

segment.source: Absolute path to the mouse pairing instruction image.
segment.target: Absolute path to the mouse pairing instruction image.

segment.source: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.
segment.target: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.

segment.source: It's scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.
segment.target: It's scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.

segment.source: Help text that displays at the bottom of the page if the mouse pairing instruction image cannot be opened.
segment.target: Help text that displays at the bottom of the page if the mouse pairing instruction image cannot be opened.

segment.source: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.
segment.target: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.

segment.source: Absolute path to the mouse pairing error image.
segment.target: Absolute path to the mouse pairing error image.

segment.source: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.
segment.target: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.

segment.source: It will be scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.
segment.target: It will be scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.

segment.source: This error text is displayed if there are issues loading the mouse pairing error image.
segment.target: This error text is displayed if there are issues loading the mouse pairing error image.

segment.source: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.
segment.target: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.

segment.source: Absolute path to the first keyboard pairing instruction image.
segment.target: Absolute path to the first keyboard pairing instruction image.

segment.source: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.
segment.target: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.

segment.source: It will be scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.
segment.target: It will be scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.

segment.source: Help text that displays at the bottom of the page if the keyboard pairing instruction image cannot be opened.
segment.target: Help text that displays at the bottom of the page if the keyboard pairing instruction image cannot be opened.

segment.source: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.
segment.target: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.

segment.source: Absolute path to the second keyboard pairing instruction image.
segment.target: Absolute path to the second keyboard pairing instruction image.

segment.source: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.
segment.target: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.

segment.source: It's scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.
segment.target: It's scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.

segment.source: Absolute path to the keyboard pairing error image.
segment.target: Absolute path to the keyboard pairing error image.

segment.source: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.
segment.target: The image must not be larger than 630 x 372 pixels.

segment.source: It's scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.
segment.target: It's scaled to fit in portrait mode or on small form factors.

segment.source: This error text is displayed if there are issues loading the keyboard pairing error image.
segment.target: This error text is displayed if there are issues loading the keyboard pairing error image.

segment.source: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.
segment.target: This text is also used by Narrator for accessibility.

segment.source: The following table shows the Registration page settings and their allowed values in OOBE.xml.
segment.target: The following table shows the Registration page settings and their allowed values in OOBE.xml.

segment.source: The ampersand symbol, '&', cannot be used in this section of OOBE.xml.
segment.target: The ampersand symbol, '&', cannot be used in this section of OOBE.xml.

segment.source: Text to title the Registration page.
segment.target: Text to title the Registration page.

segment.source: Text to describe the Registration page.
segment.target: Text to describe the Registration page.

segment.source: Value to set scope of touch keyboard.
segment.target: Value to set scope of touch keyboard.

segment.source: Value to set scope of touch keyboard.
segment.target: Value to set scope of touch keyboard.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you use no more than 100 characters because this length of text will fit on one line.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you use no more than 100 characters because this length of text will fit on one line.

segment.source: Value to set checkbox1 as selected or not selected.
segment.target: Value to set checkbox1 as selected or not selected.

segment.source: True means the check box default condition is selected.
segment.target: True means the check box default condition is selected.

segment.source: False means the check box default condition is not selected.
segment.target: False means the check box default condition is not selected.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you use no more than 100 characters because this length of text will fit on one line.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you use no more than 100 characters because this length of text will fit on one line.

segment.source: Value to set checkbox2 as selected or not selected.
segment.target: Value to set checkbox2 as selected or not selected.

segment.source: True means the check box default condition is selected.
segment.target: True means the check box default condition is selected.

segment.source: False means the check box default condition is not selected.
segment.target: False means the check box default condition is not selected.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you use no more than 100 characters because this length of text will fit on one line.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you use no more than 100 characters because this length of text will fit on one line.

segment.source: Value to set checkbox3 as selected or not selected.
segment.target: Value to set checkbox3 as selected or not selected.

segment.source: True means the check box default condition is selected.
segment.target: True means the check box default condition is selected.

segment.source: False means the check box default condition is not selected.
segment.target: False means the check box default condition is not selected.

segment.source: Label for the link to the .rtf file.
segment.target: Label for the link to the .rtf file.

segment.source: OOBE searches for files named linkfile1.rtf, linkfile2.rtf, or linkfile3.rtf under the oobe\info folder.
segment.target: OOBE searches for files named linkfile1.rtf, linkfile2.rtf, or linkfile3.rtf under the oobe\info folder.

segment.source: OOBE searches for files under the appropriate locale and language specific subfolders of oobe\info.
segment.target: OOBE searches for files under the appropriate locale and language specific subfolders of oobe\info.

segment.source: Label for the link to the .rtf file.
segment.target: Label for the link to the .rtf file.

segment.source: OOBE searches for files named linkfile1.rtf, linkfile2.rtf, or linkfile3.rtf under the oobe\info folder.
segment.target: OOBE searches for files named linkfile1.rtf, linkfile2.rtf, or linkfile3.rtf under the oobe\info folder.

segment.source: OOBE searches for files under the appropriate locale and language specific sub-folders of oobe\info.
segment.target: OOBE searches for files under the appropriate locale and language specific sub-folders of oobe\info.

segment.source: Label for the link to the .rtf file.
segment.target: Label for the link to the .rtf file.

segment.source: OOBE searches for files named linkfile1.rtf, linkfile2.rtf, or linkfile3.rtf under the oobe\info folder.
segment.target: OOBE searches for files named linkfile1.rtf, linkfile2.rtf, or linkfile3.rtf under the oobe\info folder.

segment.source: OOBE searches for files under the appropriate locale and language specific sub-folders of oobe\info.
segment.target: OOBE searches for files under the appropriate locale and language specific sub-folders of oobe\info.

segment.source: EULA file and language, locale, and timezone default values.
segment.target: EULA file and language, locale, and timezone default values.

segment.source: Language- and location-specific version of manufacturer end-user license agreement (EULA).
segment.target: Language- and location-specific version of manufacturer end-user license agreement (EULA).

segment.source: These values can be found in the following topic, Default Input Locales for Windows Language Packs.
segment.target: These values can be found in the following topic, Default Input Locales for Windows Language Packs.

segment.source: The location is specified by using a GEOID value that is converted to its decimal value.
segment.target: The location is specified by using a GEOID value that is converted to its decimal value.

segment.source: For a list of GEOIDs, see this MSDN Web site.
segment.target: For a list of GEOIDs, see this MSDN Web site.

segment.source: The locale is specified by using a locale identifier (LCID) value.
segment.target: The locale is specified by using a locale identifier (LCID) value.

segment.source: For a full list of LCIDs, see this Microsoft Global Development Web site.
segment.target: For a full list of LCIDs, see this Microsoft Global Development Web site.

segment.source: For a list of LCIDs and the versions of Windows in which they are available, download Windows Language Code Identifier (LCID) Reference from MSDN.
segment.target: For a list of LCIDs and the versions of Windows in which they are available, download Windows Language Code Identifier (LCID) Reference from MSDN.

segment.source: In this paper, in the left pane, go to Appendix A: Windows Behavior to see a table that shows the LCID and the Windows release in which it is available.
segment.target: In this paper, in the left pane, go to Appendix A: Windows Behavior to see a table that shows the LCID and the Windows release in which it is available.

segment.source: Use the keyboard value that is listed in the registry under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Control\Keyboard Layouts.
segment.target: Use the keyboard value that is listed in the registry under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Control\Keyboard Layouts.

segment.source: Specifies the time zone of the computer's end user.
segment.target: Specifies the time zone of the computer's end user.

segment.source: The time zone is set by a string that specifies the time zone for the computer.
segment.target: The time zone is set by a string that specifies the time zone for the computer.

segment.source: New time zones might appear in future releases.
segment.target: New time zones might appear in future releases.

segment.source: To add support for a new time zone, you must enter the exact time zone string.
segment.target: To add support for a new time zone, you must enter the exact time zone string.

segment.source: For a full list of time zones, refer to the values listed in the registry under HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones on a computer running Windows® 7.
segment.target: For a full list of time zones, refer to the values listed in the registry under HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones on a computer running Windows® 7.

segment.source: On a computer running Windows 7 you can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the time zone for that computer.
segment.target: On a computer running Windows 7 you can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the time zone for that computer.

segment.source: The tzutil tool is installed by default on Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: The tzutil tool is installed by default on Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: If the time zone is not specified, a default time zone value is used.
segment.target: If the time zone is not specified, a default time zone value is used.

segment.source: The default time zone is based on the installed language and region specified in an answer file.
segment.target: The default time zone is based on the installed language and region specified in an answer file.

segment.source: If a region has more than one time zone, the time zone is set to the default time zone of that region.
segment.target: If a region has more than one time zone, the time zone is set to the default time zone of that region.

segment.source: The default time zone for that region is specified by the location of the capital/major city.
segment.target: The default time zone for that region is specified by the location of the capital/major city.

segment.source: For example, if en-CA is specified, Eastern Standard Time is used as the default time zone because the Canadian capital, Ottawa, uses Eastern Standard Time.
segment.target: For example, if en-CA is specified, Eastern Standard Time is used as the default time zone because the Canadian capital, Ottawa, uses Eastern Standard Time.

segment.source: If en-US is specified as the , the time zone of the Windows installation defaults to Pacific Standard Time.
segment.target: If en-US is specified as the , the time zone of the Windows installation defaults to Pacific Standard Time.

segment.source: Specifies whether to adjust for Daylight Savings Time.
segment.target: Specifies whether to adjust for Daylight Savings Time.

segment.source: This setting is effective only when used in combination with the and settings to specify the time settings for the end user.
segment.target: This setting is effective only when used in combination with the and settings to specify the time settings for the end user.

segment.source: If this setting is not specified as True, then the Regional Settings page will be shown, even if all of the values for that page have been preconfigured.
segment.target: If this setting is not specified as True, then the Regional Settings page will be shown, even if all of the values for that page have been preconfigured.

segment.source: If this setting is not specified as True, then the Time and Date page will be shown, even if all of the values for that page have been preconfigured.
segment.target: If this setting is not specified as True, then the Time and Date page will be shown, even if all of the values for that page have been preconfigured.

segment.source: To customize OOBE by using Oobe.xml
segment.target: To customize OOBE by using Oobe.xml

segment.source: Create a file named Oobe.xml and store this file in WindowsSystem32OobeInfo.
segment.target: Create a file named Oobe.xml and store this file in WindowsSystem32OobeInfo.

segment.source: By using an XML editor or a text editor, such as Notepad, update Oobe.xml with the appropriate files, paths, and content.
segment.target: By using an XML editor or a text editor, such as Notepad, update Oobe.xml with the appropriate files, paths, and content.

segment.source: Save your updated version of Oobe.xml in WindowsSystem32OobeInfo, or in the appropriate language- and locale-specific folders required for your customizations.
segment.target: Save your updated version of Oobe.xml in WindowsSystem32OobeInfo, or in the appropriate language- and locale-specific folders required for your customizations.

segment.source: On the Start menu, point to All Programs, and then click Accessories.
segment.target: On the Start menu, point to All Programs, and then click Accessories.

segment.source: Right-click the command prompt shortcut, and click Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click the command prompt shortcut, and click Run as administrator.

segment.source: Accept the User Account Control dialog box.
segment.target: Accept the User Account Control dialog box.
